column4: guys, im about to give up. i have a directory, /home/artwork , and need to recursively find all files that end with 48.png, like blabla-48.png. just doing fine . -name "*48.png" doesnt work!

ikonia: i'm doing something like $ montage `find . -name '*48.png' -print` montage.png, but because i'm dumb i have files with characters like ' or - . how can i make find put a \ before them? or how can i make montage not get screwed up by them?
special handling of newline, -print gives you a newline after each file name, don't think montage can handle that
best is to look at the output of our find statement to see if it looks like you want before usinf it
because finde normally escapes special characters by default if my memory doesn't trump me
